requirement_tested: User registration functionality with form validation
user_persona: A new engineer named Alex who wants to join the platform to explore tools.
user_goal: To successfully register an account with valid credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Registration Form
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the homepage and sees a 'Register' button. He clicks it to open the registration form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The registration form with fields for Username, Email, and Password appears.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Out Valid Information
narrative_steps.description: Alex fills in a valid username, email address, and strong password that meets all requirements.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'alexengineer' as username, 'alex@example.com' as email, and 'SecurePass1!' as password.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each field validates input instantly, showing no errors since the data is correct.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting the Registration Form
narrative_steps.description: Confident his details are accurate, Alex clicks the submit button to finalize registration.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A success message appears confirming registration, and Alex is redirected to the login page.

user_persona: Returning user Jordan who has previously registered and now wants to access her account.
user_goal: To log into her existing account using valid credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Login Page
narrative_steps.description: Jordan opens the website and finds the 'Login' button prominently displayed. She clicks it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The login form with fields for Email and Password appears.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Jordan enters her registered email and correct password into the respective fields.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'jordan@example.com' as email and 'MySecretPass9@' as password.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: No immediate validation errors appear, indicating proper formatting of credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: She clicks the login button hoping to gain access to her dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Jordan is authenticated, receives a JWT token, and gets redirected to her dashboard with a welcome message.

requirement_tested: Tool information display including name, description, function, and price
user_persona: Taylor, a mechanical engineer browsing tools online for potential purchases.
user_goal: To browse and view basic information about available engineering tools.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Tool Listing Page
narrative_steps.description: Taylor lands on the main page where tools are listed. She expects to see key info at a glance.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage or tools listing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid of tool cards loads, each displaying the tool's name, truncated description, function summary, and price clearly.

requirement_tested: Search functionality for tools by name or keyword
user_persona: Riley, an electrical engineer looking for a specific multimeter model.
user_goal: To quickly locate a particular tool using the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Riley notices the search bar near the top of the tool listings and decides to type in a known tool name.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Fluke Multimeter' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update dynamically without reloading the page, showing only tools matching the search term.

requirement_tested: Filter functionality for tools by category, price range, or function
user_persona: Casey, a civil engineer seeking budget-friendly surveying equipment.
user_goal: To filter tools by category and price range to find affordable options.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: Casey uses the sidebar filters to select 'Surveying Equipment' under category and '$0-$200' price range.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Surveying Equipment' from Category dropdown and choose '$0-$200' radio button. Then click Apply.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The tool list updates automatically to show only filtered results matching those criteria.

requirement_tested: Detailed tool view page with full information
user_persona: Morgan, a systems engineer interested in learning more about a specific torque wrench.
user_goal: To view comprehensive details of a selected tool.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Tool Card
narrative_steps.description: Morgan browses the tool grid and clicks on a torque wrench card to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the torque wrench tool card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to a dedicated detail page showing full description, function, price, category, and other relevant information.

requirement_tested: Commenting functionality for users to comment on tools
user_persona: Jamie, a chemical engineer who recently bought a pH meter and wants to share experience.
user_goal: To leave a review comment on a purchased tool.

narrative_steps.title: Writing a Comment
narrative_steps.description: After viewing the pH meter's details, Jamie scrolls down to the comments section and writes a review.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'This pH meter works great for lab use!' into the Add Comment textarea and click Post.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The comment is submitted successfully and immediately appears in the comments list below the input area.

requirement_tested: Rating functionality for users to rate tools
user_persona: Pat, a structural engineer who tested several hammers and wants to rate one.
user_goal: To provide a star rating for a hammer they've used.

narrative_steps.title: Rating a Tool
narrative_steps.description: While viewing the hammer's detail page, Pat sees the five-star rating widget and decides to give it four stars.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the fourth star in the rating widget.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The rating is recorded, the UI reflects the chosen rating, and the overall average rating updates accordingly.

requirement_tested: Backend API to serve tool data dynamically
user_persona: Developer Sam maintaining the site backend ensuring real-time data delivery.
user_goal: To ensure the backend delivers up-to-date tool data via RESTful endpoints.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Tools Data
narrative_steps.description: Sam tests the GET /api/tools endpoint to verify dynamic data retrieval from PostgreSQL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a paginated JSON array of current tool records fetched directly from the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Frontend fetching all data from backend APIs
user_persona: DevOps engineer Lee monitoring frontend performance and API integrations.
user_goal: To confirm the frontend exclusively pulls dynamic content from backend services.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Initial Load
narrative_steps.description: Lee observes how the frontend behaves during initial load, particularly around data rendering.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage and observe network activity.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Loading indicators appear temporarily while Axios/fetch calls resolve, then dynamic content populates seamlessly.

requirement_tested: PostgreSQL database connection using specified environment variables
user_persona: System administrator Dana responsible for setting up production databases.
user_goal: To configure and validate PostgreSQL connectivity using prescribed environment settings.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: Dana checks whether the backend properly connects to PostgreSQL using standard environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Review backend configuration files and attempt to establish a database connection.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Successfully connects to PostgreSQL instance at localhost:5432 using myappuser/myapppassword for database myapp.

requirement_tested: Repository package.json configured with install:all script for frontend and backend
user_persona: New contributor Kai cloning the repository for the first time.
user_goal: To install dependencies for both frontend and backend projects efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Kai navigates to the project root and runs the unified dependency installation command.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' in the terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies install concurrently without manual intervention.

requirement_tested: Repository package.json configured with dev script to start frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: Developer Quinn working locally to develop features for both sides.
user_goal: To launch development servers for frontend and backend simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Quinn prepares to code by launching both development environments at once.
narrative_steps.action: Execute 'npm run dev' from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Development servers for both frontend and backend start concurrently, enabling integrated local development.

requirement_tested: Global background color set to ivory
user_persona: Designer Morgan reviewing visual consistency across the application.
user_goal: To verify that the global background color matches the design specification.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Morgan inspects the body element of any page to check the background color.
narrative_steps.action: Open browser DevTools and inspect the <body> tag styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The computed style shows background-color set to ivory (#FFFFF0) globally.

requirement_tested: UI components styled with forest green color
user_persona: UX designer Taylor auditing interface aesthetics and brand compliance.
user_goal: To ensure all interactive elements follow the defined color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Checking UI Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Taylor examines various UI components such as buttons and form controls for consistent styling.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect different UI elements like buttons, links, and form borders visually and via DevTools.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All specified UI components render with forest green (#228B22) as per design guidelines.
